brewery.brewery_description: Located within the confines of the Abbey, the Orval Brewery was created in 1931 to finance the enormous reconstruction works of Orval.  It has hired lay workers from the outset, including the master brewer, Pappenheimer, who invented the recipe.  The brewer‚Äôs commercial policy is adapted to the values of the monastic community.  Income from Royalties generated from the brand name go to social welfare works and the maintenance of the buildings.

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it‚Äôs time to drink it! That‚Äôs 80 check-ins with a photo.

beer.beer_description:
NOTE: The ABV-value of this beer varies, in the United States 6.9% is used.
The Orval‚Äôs brewery produces only one beer to sell, a beer with a high fermentation that continues in the bottle.  It is 6.2% ABV.  This beer is brewed exclusively from spring water, barley malt, hop cones, candy sugar, and yeast. The aroma and the fine taste are due more to the hop cones and the yeast than to the malt that is used.

What‚Äôs special about Orval‚Äôs beer is that hops are added at two different stages of the production process.  First, in the brewing room, a large quantity of very fine hops are added ‚Äì this produces the famous bitter taste and is the reason why the beer keeps for a longer period of time.  Later, in the storage cellars, hops are once again added.  This is the so-called British ‚Äúdry hopping,‚Äù which produces the delightful aroma that completely enraptures even the most carefully forewarned taster.

In the tasting room, Orval‚Äôs beer and cheese make a really good pair:  the unique shape of the bottle and the glass, the design of the label, the coasters and other publicity materials ‚Äì it‚Äôs all a legacy from the early 1930‚Äôs.

user.bio: From PBR to PTY, I check into every beer I drink.

items.badge_description: 99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 150 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 31!

items.checkin_comment:
Sweet malt, citrus blossom, berry, brett, acidic apple, dry, subtle resinous bittersweet finish. Delicious. 
üòãüçªüáßüá™

user.bio:
Trying to balance being a fast triathlete and my love of beer with my bestie
@ironwillforever on Instagram

Burning up in flames,

Reduced to nothing but ash,

Drifting on the wind

Martin lake brewery,

Founder / Brewer 

On a mission too make the best beers possible????

items.badge_description:
You obviously are a big fan of Belgian Beer, and rightfully so! Three cheers to the great Belgian beers and their uniquely crafted flavors!

That's 250 different beers from Belgium. Try 5 more for Level 51!

items.checkin_comment: It poured with a big head. The aroma is sweet and malty. The mouth feel is bright a spritzy, which masks the flavor. The flavor itself is slightly bitter and clean like a pilsner almost.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 145 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 30!
Sounds like you‚Äôre considering joining the Trappist Monks. I thought Monks couldn't drink beer? Oh well. Try 5 more for Level 3!
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 175 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 36!
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 5 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 2.

user.bio: Just a beer drinker who will try any beer at least once.

While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly what‚Äôs on tap! That's 230 check-ins at venue that is verified. Try 5 more for Level 47!

Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 425 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 86!

You obviously are a big fan of Belgian Beer, and rightfully so! Three cheers to the great Belgian beers and their uniquely crafted flavors!

That's 20 different beers from Belgium. Try 5 more for Level 5.
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 110 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 23!

Round and round the wheel goes! Which style you‚Äôll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 190 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 39!
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 155 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 32.
